Why are Amul and Nandini Sponsoring Foreign Cricket Teams? Amul and Nandini, two of India's largest dairy brands, are sponsoring foreign teams in the ICC T20 World Cup 2024. Amul sponsors the USA and South Africa teams, while Nandini backs Ireland and Scotland. Here's why: 1. Global Exposure: These sponsorships provide international visibility and help expand their global market presence. 2. Cost-Effective: Sponsoring foreign teams is cheaper than sponsoring the Indian team, making it a cost-effective marketing strategy. 3. Market Penetration: It helps brands like Amul, which recently launched fresh milk in the USA, to tap into new markets. 4. Brand Building: Associating with an international sports event enhances brand image and recognition. However, this strategy isn't without challenges, including potential disconnect with the domestic market and financial risks if the expected ROI doesn't materialize. Amul and Nandini's moves reflect a strategic blend of cost management and global ambition, leveraging cricket's global appeal to boost their brands. #valuation #linkedn #finance

Amul and Nandini are sponsoring 5 teams in the T20 World Cup, but India isn't one of them! Here's why‚Äì You see, Amul is sponsoring the cricket teams of Sri Lanka, South Africa, and the USA. On the other hand, Nandini is sponsoring Ireland and Scotland. But why aren‚Äôt either of the companies sponsoring Team India? Sounds strange, right?! Well, there is a good reason for this. Sponsoring the Indian cricket team is significantly more expensive compared to sponsoring foreign teams. For instance, in 2023, the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) set a minimum price of Rs 350 crore for Team India‚Äôs lead sponsorship rights. In contrast, Nandini secured sponsorship for Ireland and Scotland for just Rs 2.5 crore per team! Now whenever any of the teams sponsored by Amul and Nandini will play against India, they will be able to reach their audience, for a fraction of the cost! Moreover, these sponsorships mark a significant milestone for both Amul and Nandini as they continue to expand their global footprint. Amul is set to launch its products in the USA and Nandini also has plans to go global. So, do you think by sponsoring foreign cricket teams Amul and Nandini will be able to make a mark in these markets? Let us know in the comments and follow Finshots for more!
